alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 02 at 8:22PM CDT until May 02 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Northwestern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 821 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 4 miles west of Wewoka, moving east at 40 mph. Another area of circulation was located 7 miles southwest of Wewoka. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Holdenville, Wewoka, Calvin, Lamar, Horntown, Yeager, Atwood, Spaulding and Lima. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
